tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE DNASequences (
    sequence_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sequence TEXT NOT NULL,
    description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE Sequence_Records (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sequence_id INT NOT NULL,
    type_id INT NOT NULL,
    created_on TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (sequence_id) REFERENCES DNA_Sequences(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (type_id) REFERENCES Sequence_Types(type_id)
);

CREATE TABLE dna_sequences (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  sequence TEXT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  username TEXT NOT NULL,
  email TEXT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE permissions (
  permission_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  permission_name TEXT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE sequence_matches (
  match_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  sequence_id INTEGER REFERENCES dna_sequences(id),
  user_id INTEGER REFERENCES users(user_id),
  permission_id INTEGER REFERENCES permissions(permission_id)
)

CREATE TABLE mutations (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    gene_id INT,
    protein_id INT,
    mutation_type VARCHAR(50),
    FOREIGN KEY (gene_id) REFERENCES genes(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (protein_id) REFERENCES proteins(id)
);
